perturbation.original_text: As used herein, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below: "365 Gross Profits" shall mean the aggregate amount of all invoice sales of Roundup 365 less reasonable amounts for product returns and credits, trade allowances, Cost of Goods Sold applicable to Roundup 365 and 365 Distribution Costs of Roundup 365. "365 Distribution Costs" shall mean the aggregate costs for freight in, freight out, warehousing and distribution administration of Roundup 365.
perturbation.changed_text: As used herein, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below: "365 Gross Profits" shall mean the aggregate amount of all invoice sales of Roundup 365.  "365 Distribution Costs" shall mean the aggregate costs for freight in, freight out, warehousing and distribution administration of Roundup 365.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by removing the deductions for product returns, credits, trade allowances, Cost of Goods Sold and 365 Distribution Costs in the definition of '365 Gross Profits'. This creates uncertainty in calculating the actual profits, leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: Each and every Expense, either as a direct expense or an allocated one, shall only be charged to the Roundup L&G Business and consequently taken into account in the Program EBIT statements set forth in Section 3.6(c) hereto if part of a category of Expenses specifically authorized by the terms of the Annual Business Plan and within the aggregate amount prescribed in the Annual Business Plan for such category of Expense ("Budget") ("Approved Expense"). Any Expense which shall exceed its prescribed Budget shall solely be the responsibility of the party incurring it unless such expense is required to implement an approved Significant Deviation from the Annual Business Plan or is necessary to support sales orders above budgeted sales pursuant to sales programs contemplated by the Annual Business Plan.
perturbation.changed_text: Each and every Expense, either as a direct expense or an allocated one, shall be charged to the Roundup L&G Business and consequently taken into account in the Program EBIT statements set forth in Section 3.6(c) hereto whether or not it is specifically authorized by the terms of the Annual Business Plan or within the aggregate amount prescribed in the Annual Business Plan for such category of Expense ("Budget") ("Approved Expense"). Any Expense which shall exceed its prescribed Budget shall solely be the responsibility of the party incurring it unless such expense is required to implement an approved Significant Deviation from the Annual Business Plan or is necessary to support sales orders above budgeted sales pursuant to sales programs contemplated by the Annual Business Plan.
perturbation.explanation: This modification removes the requirement for expenses to be pre-approved in the Annual Business Plan to be charged to the Roundup L&G Business. This directly contradicts the later clause that expenses exceeding the budget remain the responsibility of the incurring party unless certain conditions are met, thus creating conflict.

perturbation.original_text: (a) Noncompetition Period. The "Noncompetition Period" shall be the term of this Agreement, and for the two- year period following the termination, cancellation or non-renewal of this Agreement; provided, however, that in the event (i) Monsanto terminates this Agreement pursuant to Section 10.4(a)(2) or (ii) the Agent terminates this Agreement pursuant to Section 10.5(a), the Noncompetition Period shall be deemed to terminate simultaneously upon the effective date of the termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Noncompetition Period. The "Noncompetition Period" shall be the term of this Agreement. The "Noncompetition Period" shall be the term of this Agreement, and for the two- year period following the termination, cancellation or non-renewal of this Agreement; provided, however, that in the event (i) Monsanto terminates this Agreement pursuant to Section 10.4(a)(2) or (ii) the Agent terminates this Agreement pursuant to Section 10.5(a), the Noncompetition Period shall be deemed to terminate simultaneously upon the effective date of the termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity and in-text contradiction by repeating the definition of  “Noncompetition Period” within the same paragraph. This makes it unclear whether the non-competition period is solely the term of the agreement or also includes a two-year period post-termination, thus creating conflict.
